attributes.action: Reallocate BBC licence fee to assist with the Chancellors budget plan.
attributes.background: UK households are expected to pay £147.50 per year to own a television raking in £3.7bn quite frankly ridiculous in 2016 and compares to the window tax of 1696. Money that would be better spent elsewhere, NHS, Education.... the deficit? We pay it anyway, I suggest we spend it where its needed.
attributes.additional_details:
When the Chancellor is still looking to make cuts £3.7bn would go a long way to help balance the books.

BBC finances report 2013/14 that they took in £3.7bn from households in the UK up £16m from the previous year. 

Follow the downloadable link to 'Full finance statement 2013-14' page 4 http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/summary-financial-statement.html 

BBC Finances report 14/15 - http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/pdf/2014-15/bbc-annualreport-201415.pdf

attributes.action: Provide the needed equipment to stop the collapse of the Mosul Dam.
attributes.background: The Mosul Dam is near collapse, with upcoming flooding threatening to cause the dam to break. If it did break, it's estimated that the ensuing flood could kill over 1,000,000 people, and displace millions more, causing a horrific level of death, and further increasing the scale of the Migrant Crisis
attributes.additional_details:
The Mosul Dam was built out of a material requiring continuous grouting in order to retain its structural integrity. In the aftermath of ISIS's capturing of the Dam, the grouting equipment was lost, and they don't have enough manpower to both fight ISIS and protect the dam. The Government should spend a section of its foreign aid/defence budget on providing this equipment, and in some manner freeing up the Peshmerga or the local population to regrout the the dam.

http://bit.ly/1RSTTb1

attributes.action: Completely ban Sunday trading for high-street retailers.
attributes.background: Sunday is a special day, families and communities gather on the seventh day to 'rest.' Unfortunately, the majority of employment contracts make workers who would participate in religious activities or spend time with their families have to go to work.
attributes.additional_details: It's sad to see that as Sunday trading laws have become more lenient, divorce rates have increased. Family time is now more unusual and many people refused to do such things as mow the lawn on Sundays until supermarkets broke the law and got their way.

attributes.action: Make a it criminal offence for a dog to worry livestock, e.g mauling lambs
attributes.background: Dogs mauling lambs is becoming more frequent.  Not only is the devastation they wreak an economic loss to the farmer but it is also a welfare issue because of the distress it causes to the ewes that lose the lambs. They should at least be afforded the same level of protection by law as wild animals

attributes.action: Educate 11-18 s in self-defence, financial management and emotional literacy.
attributes.background: Many students leave school unaware of how to manage everyday finances. Students need to be taught how to express their feelings.  The growth in eating disorders among young men shows this to be a priority.Introducing self-defence education will help protect young people from social dangers.

attributes.action: Provide funding, equipment, training & materials to repair to Iraq's Mosul Dam
attributes.background:
Mosul dam is in danger of catastrophic collapse potentially killing over 1,000,000 people. Continuous repairs have been severely curtailed due to past conflict. A contract for a specialist contractor to repair the foundations remains unsigned as of 29/02/16.

Inaction will result in loss of life.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul_Dam

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/mar/02/mosul-dam-engineers-warn-it-could-fail-at-any-time-killing-1m-people

attributes.action: Recognise Israel's atrocities against Palestinians and take action to stop it.
attributes.background:
Israel continues to breach the human rights of Palestinians in its illegal occupation of the West Bank  and Gaza. 

I, as a UK citizen petition the UK Government to take action to isolate Israel in the international community until it changes its course and ends its apartheid against Palestinians.
attributes.additional_details:
The action should include:

1. Draft a fresh UN resolution. 
2. Impose full sanctions against Israel
3. Stop selling arms.
4. Proscribe the IDF as a weapon of terror. 
5. Require a plebiscite open to all residents (including refugees) to vote for either a 1 State solution where everyone has 100% equal rights or for a 2 State solution where both States are recognised and have all the comensurate rights and responsibilities of nationhood. 
6. Establish a legal process to compensate Palestinians.

attributes.action: Give Ghurkas automatic citizenship.
attributes.background: Ghurkas are proud to serve this country and are a well respected members of the armed forces. Why should they have to apply for something and pay for it when they have already shown more loyalty to this country than some of the citizens who were born here.

attributes.action: Require all Members of Parliament to wear a uniform.
attributes.background: Given that some MPs are unable to behave with a maturity greater than that found in a year 8 classroom, they should be required, by law, to wear a uniform, whilst attending the House of Commons, to prevent bullying or harrassment on the basis of socioeconomic background and focus on their work.
attributes.additional_details:
In school, uniforms, prevent bullying, discrimination or otherwise mean behaviour by preventing children from being able to distinguish between each other on a socio-economic basis. Children of wealthy parents are unable to critique other children on the basis of the clothes they wear.

Since this behaviour is also found in the House of Commons it should be curbed by imposing a uniform, similar to ones found in schools across the country.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-35651049

attributes.action: Implement a fine system for disrespectful MPs during Prime Minister's Questions.
attributes.background:
PMQs is an opportunity for MPs to debate the matters that affect us. Currently it is a circus of crude, jeering, infantile behaviour.

No workplace should permit this sort of behaviour & as our representatives, MPs should conform to a higher standard, engaging in the debate, not petty squabbling!

attributes.action: support the make a difference and stop the violence campaign
attributes.background: there is a campaign for better treatment for victims of domestic abuse sexual abuse and rape we have 6 demands we want the government to meet to make life better for all the victims
attributes.additional_details: 1 put a independent unit with councils so they can directly fund charities who care and support victims 2 more resources and training for survivors who want to go on to help others 3 make it part of the national curriculum to educate children about abuse and learn about the morals and values around sex 4 get legal aid back for victims going through family court 5 more safety around access to children 6 tougher punishment for abusers

attributes.action: Environment Agency must clean up the abandoned Waste4Fuel site
attributes.background:
The Environment Agency failed to police the Waste4Fuel site, planning permission was granted to hold 5 tons of waste, the abandoned site holds 18 tons of waste. Cleanup has been promised to no avail. 
 
The site continues to a) catch fire & b) pollute the air.

attributes.action: Government should not delay initiating secession because of Germans and French
attributes.background:
Delaying Article 50 because of German and French General Elections in 2017 is a political ruse on the part of Theresa May as the negotiations will not be affected by either result.

There is no reason why negotiations cannot start because a change will be to our advantage and make them easier.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, the two most formidable opponents of Britain in any post Brexit deal will be Merkel and Hollande.  That is the worst case scenario.

If Merkel is displaced, it will likely be by the election of candidates from the AfD.  If Hollande is displaced, it will likely be by the Front Nationale.  In both cases, they are highly Eurosceptical Parties and therefore unlikely to make it difficult for a British withdrawal. They are far more likely to give a good deal for us than at present.

attributes.action: Raise benefits for the disabled
attributes.background: We are from NCS and we're supporting Skills for Life, a charity who help people with learning disabilities. Recent changes to our community has caused living with a disability much more difficult as benefits have been cut. Therefore, we would love to help and raise benefits for the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all the great things charities such as Skills for Life do, they now have to charge their service users to continue they're amazing work. This should not be the case, especially now that it is becoming less affordable due to the cut in benefits.

attributes.action: Change law so a learner can ride a 250cc motorcycle once passed car test or CBT.
attributes.background:
Please change the law for learner motorcycle riders.
Please change from 125cc to 250cc for learner riders. 
Many accidents happen due to mopeds having small wheels.
It's pretty easy for the front wheel to slip away on a corner. Bikes with larger wheel don't usually have this problem.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also help the environment as 4stroke engines would be available. These are much cleaner with less pollutants entering the atmosphere.
If publicised right it could mean less cars on the already busy roads.

attributes.action: Debate changes in child welfare law and update the guidelines
attributes.background: Legislation regarding child welfare and guidelines social work departments work under are outdated. And leaving children vulnerable and at risk.. The law needs updating and quickly, specifically sections related to child abuse verbally abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for the law on child neglect, written in 1933, to be overhauled to protect children from being badly fed, left alone at home, not educated or belittled and bullied by their parents.

The 1933 law requires that a child is physically harmed or injured before charges can be brought, yet child neglect is the most common form of maltreatment. It is suggested that around 1.5 million children are affected.

attributes.action: Save the Battle of Britain display at the Royal Aircraft Museum.
attributes.background: While at the RAF Museum I saw that many of the exhibits in the Battle of Britain Hall were being dismantled.  It appears the BoB Museum will be no more and the aircraft therein will be dispersed, either to areas within the Hendon site, RAF Cosford or put in storage.

attributes.action: Those with IBD to be allowed parking spaces outside their home
attributes.background: There are an estimated 300,000 people living with IBD in the UK, and not all of these people can register as disabled. This means that those who don't have a driveway or a designated parking space outside their home can struggle to park and get inside quickly when suffering a flare up.
attributes.additional_details:
A painted bay, or a designated parking space outside a sufferer's home would make a great difference.
It's not just IBD, there are thousands of people within the UK that suffer from chronic illness that would benefit from a parking space outside their home.
Local councils will not help as some sufferers cannot register as disabled, and therefore are not legally obliged to help and in may cases won't.
We're not asking to park in disabled bays, just the ability to park outside our own homes.

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying

attributes.action: If UK weather reaches 30degrees people should get sent home from work on pay.
attributes.background:
Comfortable working environment.
To hot to work indoors. I.e factory's etc or any buildingwith broken aircon or without any Aircon.
attributes.additional_details:
UK workers.
Factory's,call centers etc or any other place with no aircon facilities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use national flags for party political purposes.
attributes.background: National symbols, e.g. the Union Jack and St George's Cross, are often used by political parties wishing to add legitimacy to their views. This means that symbols that should represent everyone, regardless of politics, ethnicity or religion, have become linked to particular political agendas.

attributes.action: Call for Turkey's removal from NATO
attributes.background:
The North Atlantic Council, should formally oust Turkey from NATO for good before its belligerence and continual aggression drags the international community into World War III.
Under Erdogan, our NATO ally has arrested more journalists than China, jailed thousands for the crime of free speech.
attributes.additional_details: Erdogan publicly flaunted his support for Hamas & ISIS while accusing Israel of crimes against humanity, violated an arms ban to Gaza, bought an air defense system from the Chinese in defiance of NATO, and denied America the use of its own air base to conduct strikes during the Iraqi War & ISIS in Syria. Turkey has been tacitly fueling the ISIS war machine. There is evidence to show that Turkey has allowed jihadists from around the world to swarm into Syria by crossing through Turkey’s territory

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act

attributes.action: Harsher penalties for racially abusing foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians.
attributes.background: Having seen people being racist and xenophobic towards foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians on the TV and in newspapers, it has angered me and I have had enough of it. I would like to see harsher penalties introduced to help reduce hate crime in the UK.

attributes.action: Allow all people with terminal conditions access to trial drugs.
attributes.background: Developing drugs is a lengthy process. When drugs first display effectiveness, the path to approval for use is a long one, to ensure the benefits outweigh any potential risks. But nothing is more risky than death and the terminally ill may be denied potentially life saving treatments in this wait.
attributes.additional_details: The current process of drug development for the terminally ill leaves patients with little power or hope. It feels like what the patient wants is being ignored. In some cases drugs are denied from the rest of the patient population for years after being shown to save lives in the condition, allowing avoidable death on a massive scale. There are many terminal conditions that share this frustration affecting adults and children and babies. Everyone should have the right to the best chance to live.

attributes.action: Hold General Election once a Tory leader's found & before Artcle 50 is triggered
attributes.background: The U.K. Government should represent the people of the U.K.  Following the recent referendum both major parties at Westminster have seemingly imploded. Once new party leaders have been found the UK should decide who is right to govern them.
attributes.additional_details: This should also be done before Article 50 is invoked so that the Prime Minister leading the negotiations has the backing of the people

attributes.action: Require candidates to have lived for 5 years in the area they want to be MP in.
attributes.background: Our MPs seem increasingly divorced from the people who elect them. This isn't helped by all parties choosing to parachute non local candidates into constituencies with which they have no links. Making it compulsory to live within the constituency for 5 years before standing would stop this practice
attributes.additional_details: According to Smith Institute Data, MPs have a very different background to the electorate. 33% are privately educated and 23% went to Oxbridge. The number of professional politicians in parliament has risen from 3.7% to 25% since 1979 while the % of manual workers has fallen from 15.8 to 4. Too often the party central offices are choosing candidates from the Westminster village and sending them to stand in seats in the provinces where they are unrepresentative of the people voting for them

attributes.action: Yorkshire should secede from the UK and form its own country.
attributes.background: For years now, Yorkshire has been held back by the British government and it is time for this to end. Yorkshire needs to gain independence in order to save the Yorkshire people.

attributes.action: Allow HM Armed forces to be able to vote at their current base UK or worldwide.
attributes.background: Due to the busy and unpredictable nature of their jobs Service personnel have found it difficult to vote in person or by post/proxy and often don't get to have their say on matters and the things that ultimately effect their careers, families and their country they are proud to serve.

attributes.action: Make BBC Parliament exempt from the TV licencing requirements
attributes.background: It is ridiculous at best, and undemocratic at worst, that in order to watch our elected representatives at work we're required to pay the BBC a licence fee. Whilst the argument is understandable for other BBC services, we should not have to pay to watch the democratic process of our country at work.

attributes.action: Use government resources to co-ordinate a modern Buy British campaign.
attributes.background: We can make and grow world-class produce and services in the UK.  Buying British is the most effective way to avoid recession now and spur long-term GDP growth regardless of EU membership.

attributes.action: For ALL EU Protected Sites & Species to carry on being so even if not in the EU
attributes.background: We have various species and sites in the UK that are currently protected by EU law.  We must ensure that these continue to be protected within the UK even if we are no longer part of the European Union due to the result of the recent democratic vote.
attributes.additional_details:
A few links to various species and sites that are currently protected: 
http://jncc.defra.gov.uk/page-1747
https://www.gov.uk/topic/environmental-management/wildlife-habitat-conservation

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: Verify the quantum of EU Referendum votes made on the basis of lies & untruths
attributes.background: The 23 June 2016 EU Referendum, has set a path for the UK which is likely to cause significant damage to the economy and send the UK into recession. It has emerged that many voters cast their votes on the basis of lies, untruths and misrepresentation of facts by both the Leave & Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the Leave and Remain Campaigns backtracking on the various promises and statements that they made to the electorate,  the leading polling consultants have now determined that many voters cast their votes on the basis of these claims that have now been proven to be lies and untruths and many voters have confirmed they would now cast their votes differently.

The Government needs to determine if this sample is statistically relevant and if it could have affected the outcome of the result

attributes.action: CHANGE THE LAW TO PROTECT ANIMALS FROM THREATS OF VIOLENCE AND DEATH FROM PEOPLE
attributes.background: Animal protection laws need to be change so it become illegal for people to threaten to kill someones animals.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands at the moment it is not a criminal offence to tell people that they will kill your animals and they can get away with with completely until they have caused harm to the animal. We need to have this changed so that people will get some kind of criminal conviction for threatening peoples animals.

attributes.action: Stop Imports from Germany
attributes.background: The 3 month forecast shows for the month of April, the UK spent nearly 9 billion pounds on imports from Germany alone, Now that we have voted as a country and have decided to leave the Eu they are playing around with the pound, Nothing has stopped as of yet and trade remains the same. And for why ?
attributes.additional_details:
We need to stop trade with Germany, We need to stay together as a country and stay strong, Lets not let them play us, we can trade else where. 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/527976/OTS_Release_0416.pdf

We need to focus on world trade and get our £ on a good exchange and to do this we need to stop trade with those who are trying to bring us down.

attributes.action: Ban petitions relating to election results as it insults democracy
attributes.background: There has been a glut of petitions which call for another vote when things don't go their way.  This insults our voters, makes a mockery of the democratic process and wastes time as its debated.  It also undermines other petitions which may have real value and real merit.

attributes.action: Create a multi-party team to negotiate the exit from the EU including MYPs
attributes.background: The exit from the EU has a long term impact. MYPs (youth parliamentarians) should be included in a new multi party team that leads the exit rather than the leader of the largest party in Westminster. This team needs to reflect the views and background of the nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: There are 12 different political parties with MPs in Westminster. There are 369 MYPs. The young have the most to lose from a poorly negotiated exit. Let's ensure a democratically representative task force, including all parties and elected young people leads the exit process. This will avoid the exit being led by a team with an unrepresentative perspective on what we in the UK want. This gives us a chance at getting the democracy in the UK that we deserve.

attributes.action: We need a Government of National Unity elected by Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: Solving the EU withdrawal problems will require help from the best of politicians, regardless of their political persuasions. With Proportional Representation every vote will again count and every voter's interest will be protected.

attributes.action: European Union Referendum, 75% Required
attributes.background: Call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the Remain or Leave vote is less than 75% then the Referendum Vote to Remain or to Leave the European Union is conducted again, until we reach 3/4 of the United Kingdom agreeing to either Remain or to Leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship to all migrants living in the UK on the 23rd June 2016.
attributes.background: Let's start the UK's move to full sovereignity with a promise to migrants, both EU and otherwise,  that they will be entitled to full citizenship if they were registered as living in the UK on the 23rd of June 2016.

attributes.action: In future votes ballot slip to carry a warning that once cast the vote is final
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote and stories in the press that people voted out/remain as a protest and now wish to change their vote ballot slips should carry a warning that once placed in the ballot box your vote is final and can not be changed
attributes.additional_details: Also people should be made aware that in a democratic voting process when one side should win more votes than the other no matter how slim the margin the side with the most votes wins and there is no option to rerun the vote

attributes.action: Let Bristol & London remain in the EU following a majority in the referendum
attributes.background: Following on from the EU referendum, Bristol & London both had an overwhelming majority vote to remain with Bristol at 62% & London at 73.5%. They should therefore be allowed to remain in the EU governed as separate county states by local government.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create an independent City State of London & the surrounding areas.
attributes.background: Due to the recent European Referendum result, it's apparent that London has a significantly different outlook in regards to the rest of the world. We therefore wish for London to break away from the UK and become an independent, sovereign nation.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Lobby FIFA to remove World Cup 2018 from current hosts Russia
attributes.background: A recent history of racist and homophobic chants and threats at Russian stadia, plus the well planned and brutal attacks on England fans at Euro 2016 strongly suggests Russia is a very poor choice to host World Cup 2018. The UK Government alongside the English FA should pressure FIFA to move it.
attributes.additional_details: Russian 'fans' have organised attacks during Euro 2016 resulting in serious injuries http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36515213. A Russian MP has backed the attacks, "I see nothing wrong with football fans fighting. On the contrary, well done to our boys! Keep up the good work!" https://twitter.com/Russian1972/status/742256350424641536). FARE has documented incidents of racists & homophobic nature in Russian football http://www.farenet.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/SOVA-monitoring-report.pdf

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Sporting events involving national team/competitor
attributes.background: It is absolutely disgraceful that I as a British national should have to pay to watch my national team compete in a sporting event. All sporting events involving any national team or competitor must by law be screened on terestrial television.
